thread.title: Tech firm ITPS to create new jobs following £3m finance deal to fuel expansion

author: Coreena Ford
title: Tech firm ITPS to create new jobs following £3m finance deal to fuel expansion
text:

The North East’s largest data facility is set to expand and create new jobs after its founder sealed a £3m finance deal.
Technology firm IT Professional Services (ITPS) is set to expand its data centre in Chester-le-Street as part of a new phase of growth, thanks to the seven-figure financial package from HSBC.
The Gateshead-based data centre business, which was launched in 2000 and specialises in IT consultancy, implementation and support, signed a deal to create the 33,000sqft data centre back in 2014, making it the largest North East facility of its kind.
Now the firm, which is a leader in information and communication technologies, will use the funding to meet increasing national and international customer demand by adding a second data hall to its existing, industry-leading facility.
The new data hall will include over 3,000 square feet of fully-serviced rack space, and sit alongside its onsite dedicated workspace recovery centre.
The expansion is also expected to generate new jobs across the company, from engineering to administration roles, to join the existing 120-strong workforce. Read More Northgate sees turnover top £700m but UK vehicle rentals fall
ITPS finance director, Michael Jopling, said: “Building the new data hall underpins our second stage of ambitious growth, and we could not have done this without the great support we’ve received from HSBC. It means we will be able to create new jobs in the North East, and ensure we are competitive for both national and international clients.”
Tony Leech, area director for HSBC North East, added: “ITPS is a 21st century company looking to meet the exciting opportunities in a quickly evolving industry, and we are very excited to be a part of this next step of its evolution.” Read More Thousands of North East car industry jobs being put at risk by Brexit
Accountancy firm Tait Walker worked on improving ITPS’ information management ahead of the deal.
Graham Dotchin, associate at Tait Walker, added: “It has been fantastic helping ITPS shape its significant volumes of data into manageable insights. We are sure this investment will allow them to continue its impressive growth story.” Like us on Facebook
